title: Mamidas Qva (Aunts Stone)
about: Mamidas Qva (translation “Aunt’s Stone) is located in Kvemo Kartli region, Tetritskaro municipality, near the village of Gokhnari. Mamidas Qva is a stone carved from a large boulder and dates back to the IV-VI centuries. There are reliefs in the center of the cross. Currently, it is lying on the ground. Two smaller stone crosses are erected near Mamidas Qva. Locals believed that these fallen stone cross had supernatural forces. Even during the Soviet Times, the weather ritual was held here by the invited priest.
